document_data.name: House of Mirth
document_data.mainbody: The '''House of Mirth''' was an inn in [[Bralizzar]], a [[caravanserai]] in the [[Dustwall Mountains]] in the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|18}}
document_data.Location: The House of Mirth lay along the west side of the Bazaar, south of the Boulevard.{{cite book/Desert of Desolation|17}} This inn was advertised only by a red tile set beside the door.
document_data.Structure: Its main room was long and narrow, several steps up from the rest of the street. It was well-appointed, with large cushions, small tables, and an elegant carpet. The illumination came from niches in the walls.
document_data.Services: The establishment was of middling quality, in between that of the [[Inn of the Golden Palm]] and [[the Swayback Camel]]. The meals were reasonable and the clientele was not dangerous.
document_data.Staff: The proprietor was [[Tasha Lal]], who employed three women.
